newsitem.title: USA: Plains feedlot cattle market quiet - feedlots.
newsitem.headline: Plains feedlot cattle market quiet - feedlots.

text.p: U.S. Plains direct cattle markets late Wednesday morning remained at a standstill, with no trades reported, feedlot sources said.
Packer bids ranged from $68.00 to mostly $69.00 per cwt, but were passed, with cattle feeders asking $71.00 to $72.00.
Owners remain optimistic that cattle will trade later Wednesday or on Thursday at $70.00, up $1.00 from last week's top price, the sources said.
Prices were expected to be buoyed by light supplies of market-ready cattle and strong demand for beef by retailers to refill coolers following the Labor Day holiday.
